1: Protect me, O God, for I have taken shelter in you.[c]
2: I say to the Lord, “You are the Lord, my only source of well-being.”[d]
3: As for God's chosen people who are in the land, and the leading officials I admired so much[e]—
4: their troubles multiply; they desire other gods.[f] I will not pour out drink offerings of blood to their gods,[g] nor will I make vows in the name of their gods.[h]
5: Lord, you give me stability and prosperity;[i] you make my future secure.[j]
6: It is as if I have been given fertile fields or received a beautiful tract of land.[k]
7: I will praise[l] the Lord who[m] guides[n] me; yes, during the night I reflect and learn.[o]
8: I constantly trust in the Lord;[p] because he is at my right hand, I will not be shaken.
9: So my heart rejoices and I am happy;[q] my life is safe.[r]
10: You will not abandon me[s] to Sheol;[t] you will not allow your faithful follower[u] to see[v] the Pit.[w]
11: You lead me in[x] the path of life.[y] I experience absolute joy in your presence;[z] you always give me sheer delight.[aa]
